description: Generate UI button components in authentic 8-bit pixel art style, reminiscent of classic retro computing and gaming interfaces. Perfect for nostalgic web applications, retro-themed games, and vintage terminal-inspired interfaces.

typography.characteristics: Pixelated, chunky letterforms with authentic CRT terminal appearance

default.shadow: Hard drop shadow or none, no gradients
default.texture: Flat color fills, possible dithering patterns

hover.effect: Color shift to accent-hover, possible pixel shimmer effect
hover.transition: Instant or stepped animation (no smooth transitions)
hover.feedback: Border color change or simple glow effect

active.effect: Inverted colors or pressed-down appearance with shadow removal
active.displacement: 1-2px downward shift to simulate button press

disabled.appearance: Reduced contrast, dithered pattern, or muted colors
disabled.interaction: No hover effects, cursor indicates non-clickable state

decoration.icons: Simple geometric shapes or ASCII characters
decoration.effects: CRT scanlines, phosphor glow, or pixelated noise

buttonVariants.appearance: Red tones (#ff4444 or similar pixel-era red)
Green tones (#44ff44 or similar pixel-era green)

technicalConstraints.resolution: Design at low resolution then scale up (16x16, 32x32 base)
technicalConstraints.shadows: Hard shadows only, no blur or gradients
technicalConstraints.animations: Frame-by-frame or stepped, no smooth easing

accessibilityConsiderations.contrast: Ensure WCAG AA compliance despite retro aesthetic
accessibilityConsiderations.focusStates: Clear pixel-art focus indicators (dotted borders, color shifts)
accessibilityConsiderations.textSize: Minimum readable size despite pixelated font
accessibilityConsiderations.colorBlindness: Test with different color vision deficiencies

usageInstructions: Use this prompt to generate pixel-perfect 8-bit style button designs. Specify the button text, type (primary/secondary/etc.), and any specific color preferences. The output will maintain authentic retro computing aesthetics while ensuring modern usability standards. Ideal for retro-themed applications, vintage gaming interfaces, and nostalgic web experiences.

examples.input: Create a primary action button with text 'START GAME' in pixel 8-bit style using the PixelOS color scheme
examples.expectedOutput: A rectangular button with thick pixel borders, VT323 font, accent color (#6AB0A2) background, sharp corners, and proper hover state with color shift to #548C7F
